messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2299
messages.msgSnippet: Don t you think that all of us newbies just need to keep thinking that its(unschooling) is just living life?!  I think that is the hardest part for all of us
messages.messageBody:
Don't you think that all of us newbies just need to keep thinking that its(unschooling) is just living life?! I think that is the hardest part for all of us converted ps people to get our minds around. Its not seperate. I think many of you have said it many times and that's what seems to help me. Hope that helps Tanya a little. Kelli
PSoroosh@... wrote:In a message dated 8/27/2002 8:55:57 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> <<So forgive me if the advice to just let your child play doesn't quite get
> it
> for me. >>
>
> I've always just let my children play, and they're 10, 13 and 16. I play
> with them. We play at the grocery store, we play with ideas, we play with
>
> music and words and tools.

And we play with numbers and mathematical concepts and with writing stories
and letters and articles and we play games and we play with our food, too <G>
.

-pamS

National Home Education Network
http://www.NHEN.org
Changing the Way the World Sees Homeschooling!
